data.title: Beautiful city scape
data.text: We walked across from the state capitol to walk through this park. There were a lot of homeless but the park itself was beautiful. Great views of both city hall and state capitol as well as the mountains.

data.title: Nice walk around Denver
data.text: Denver is a very walking friendly city. The park is nice and close to 16th Mall and the Art Museum. At nighttime the surrounding builds are lit up. It's very pretty. I was there alone and felt very safe. Worth the short walk from most downtown hotels!

data.title: Homeless central
data.text:
This is one uncomfortable park to go through. While largely harmless and will leave you alone in this area, I saw nothing but homeless person after homeless person at this park and surrounding areas. Probably >100 of them.

The park also seemed to be under maintenance when I went - I didn't even pull out a camera as there was just nothing worthwhile taking a photo of.

data.title: Park day
data.text: Great to walk around. City hosts evnts that are fun to attend! Very pretty park. Great for a Sunday afternoon!

data.title: Homeless living quarters
data.text: We only go here when there is a festival, like Cinco De Mayo, Veterans Parade, Festival of Lights, or Taste of Colorado. Otherwise it's full of homeless people.

data.title: Mile High Beauty
data.text: No matter the time of year, Civic Center Park is a must see. It is well kept with flowers in the summer and lots of events year round. Don't miss on your visit to Denver.

data.title: Good for Events but gets way too crowded
data.text: Broncos Super Bowl celebration parades, 4th of July fireworks and countless other events are centered around this park. Everyone knows this very central location, and it gets super busy. Even on days with no events, there are people milling about.

data.title: Rock N Roll Denver Half marathon start/finish
data.text: I visited this park as part of running the Rock N Roll Denver Half Marathon. I went the day before the race to check out the area, then enjoyed the park after finished the race Oct. 16. It really is a nice park. I'm sure it is used by a lot of venues and events. Nice that it is right downtown to offer some green space.

data.title: The Center of downtown Denver, Colorado. A mecca of activities for all the community.
data.text: Every time you future downtown and you usually, on the weekends, find something going on for the people, free concerts, community celebrations, Athletic launches or parades, Holidays the area are lite up like Disneyland. The area is full of beautiful government buildings and downtown is full of other things to do! Great Downtown focal point.

data.title: Food Trucks!!!!!!
data.text: The park has food trucks during lunch hour three days a week and thankfully we visited on a day they were there.  Lines upon lines of food trucks.  Excellent food (plenty of choices) and great atmosphere.

data.title: Great when there's an event, but not so much otherwise
data.text: This is a beautiful park & great to go to events at; i.e. Taste of Colorado. Unfortunately it's a little rough when there's no other events going on. There are quite a few homeless people there. Most of them are harmless, but it can be a bit unnerving seeing them use drugs or passed out on the sidewalks. That being said, it's very well maintained & landscaped.

data.title: Great location
data.text: We visited Civic Center Park on several occasions during our week's stay in Denver. The Taste of Colorado was there for three days with lots of great bands, food and entertainment. Then we passed through on our way to the Capitol tour and it was our meeting place for our free Denver walking tour. It is a nice park with plenty of green spaces and some nice statues.

data.title: Good location for summer festivals
data.text: While the park is well situated between the capitol and many Denver attractions it really is overrun by homeless people and other interesting sort of people near the RTD stops. The park is great for holding big festivals and events but I wouldn't come here for a walk/run early in the day as the park is mostly empty and  I don't feel as safe as I do in nearby city parks.

data.title: Taste of Colorado
data.text: I've always heard good thing but never made until this year. All throughout Civic Center Park vendors set up their food booths and craft displays. I spent a couple of hours getting a taster portion, an ice cream or a drink listening to the music and watching the people. The Taste of Colorado was clean, we'll organized and a boat load of fun. I look forward to next Labor Day weekend.

data.title: awesome setting
data.text: we love this park because the setting is so cute.  you have a view of the capital building and the courthouse.  it is really quite beautiful.  if you are visiting either building, take a picnic and sit on the benches.

data.title: It's alright, if you happen to be in the neighborhood
data.text: The park is located at one end of 16th Street Mall and across the street from the state capitol. So, if you happen to be in the area, it's a nice green spot for a short walk. Most of the green was taken up by reclining homeless. But, the columns and the civic building both were lovely to look at.

data.title: Taste of Colorado
data.text: Took bus and then free 16th street mall bus up to park.  It was super expensive with very little in art kiosks but tons of food trucks and different areas for music venues as well as a whole amusement park for kids.  We will skip it next time.

data.title: Beautiful Park Across from the Colorado State Capitol!!!
data.text: Civic Center Park is a true blessing to Denver citizens and visitors to our city. Seated in the heart of central Denver it is a wonderful place to spend an afternoon while visiting the city.

data.title: Center of many venues within a mile
data.text: Capitol to the right, city court to the left. Museum behind you, Denver mint and Library within a block.  Catch the Free bus down 16 street mall.   Homeless as in most cities are are present, but not a problem with visitors. Very safe during daylight hours.

data.title: Beautiful park, marred countless homeless tragedies
data.text: This park between the state capitol and the Denver city building is gorgeous, and weekdays it looks like there is a daily food truck line up for lunch. unfortunately because it a public space, it is also ground zero for the homeless population of denver. We saw countless homeless people and witnessed a few altercations between them. anyone travelling to denver should know that the homeless population is huge in the summer.
